snippet: People familiar with the appointment process say the vetting of Ms. Kennedy is nearly complete.
abstract: Caroline Kennedy, daughter of President John F Kennedy, appears likely to be next United States ambassador to Japan; her vetting by the White House is almost complete, and appointment could be announced in coming weeks, along with names of several other choices for important diplomatic posts.
lead_paragraph: People familiar with the appointment process say the vetting of Ms. Kennedy is nearly complete.

headline.seo: Caroline Kennedy Is Seen as Likely Choice for Japan Envoy
headline.main: Caroline Kennedy Is Seen as Likely Choice for Japan Envoy
headline.print_headline: Caroline Kennedy Is Seen as Likely Choice for Japan Envoy
